messages.content: a simple basic block card
the counterpart to wild strike
but IMO quite a lot better
the status is a lot less painful
It's not horrible
I'm never happy about having it, but rarely upset by it either
slimed is better than wound
and block is better than equivalent damage
<wild strike>

embeds.title: Wild Strike
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :red_energy: / The Ironclad / Slay the Spire

Deal 12 (17) damage.
Shuffle a Wound into your draw pile.

messages.content: plus auto doesn't lack damage except early
frontloaded block, a rare comodity in today's society
Auto needs frontloaded block way more than it needs a clean draw pile
That said I only take wild strike if I'm trying to make a fire-breathing deck and I don't know if the Auto version of that deck is good
it's a feature can do cool stuff
I always get distracted by shiny encode cards first
Yeah statuses are just outshined, even if they still are good
insert sounds more wrong the more I say it, I don't like it as a keyword
<insert>

messages.content: "insert 1 slimed" sounds dirty now that I think about it..... ._.

sticky shield is a pretty mid card. Provides okay block by automation standards (ya 11 for one is just "okay" holy moly this character is busted). the slimed can be a minor benefit in status decks; although you usually prefer a card like break to generate a lot of statuses at a time. Most of the time though that slimed is bad and will prevent you from drawing into functions that give way more block.
this card isnt so bad that you would remove it from your deck from a transform; but its one that you rarely need to see

This card seems really horrible to me? It just looks so bad compared to a safeguard or a constructor. I almost never take it and have not regretted that so far. Not sure exactly when I should, if that is wrong.
after you've killed nob and are going into elite 2
Yeah, could be, that's a very narrow window
you've also got <gelatinous cube> and <bug barrage> hyper synergy

embeds.title: Gelatinous Cube
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Downfall

Whenever you draw a **Status** card, draw 1 card.
*Hey, it stuck to your body.*

embeds.title: Bug Barrage
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

Gain 1 (2) Wound (Wounds).
**Cycle** each **Status**, dealing 7 damage for each.

messages.content: add more fuel to the fire

In theory, this card should be quite good for automaton. It fits in nicely with the "bug" based status synergies, slime isn't that bad of a status, and it provides a nice amount of frontloaded block. The front-loaded block in particular should be very valuable, as automaton has a weak first cycle through the deck, and needs to buy some time to complete functions and reshuffle before really coming online. You also are so naturally good at scaling that front-load tends to be your biggest vulnerability as automaton, so covering that should make sticky shield quite a solid addition.

In practice, I just haven't found this card to feel necessary. As long as you can find a few decent ways to make your first cycle through the deck better and bolster your mitigation package (fortify, null pointer, frontloaded relics), you will usually be fine. Maybe part of it comes from your starting relic (bronze core) which does a great job of providing front-load and burst for you, covering the same weakness sticky shield tries to without a drawback. Even the block based encode cards (branch, frontload, safeguard, not really delayed guard) can perform a similar job to sticky shield once you complete the function and play the supercard for just 1 energy. Perhaps this is just a case where the rest of the character is so strong, that this card feels weak by comparison. Why take the drawback when you could just play something else more powerful?

At it's best in act 2 as a way to efficiently deal with the enemies high damage, especially if you missed the 4th energy. Quite rough in act, since you have a smaller deck (making the slime more dangerous), and as a defensive skill against the elites. Upgrade is notably weak, it's a +3 sure, but that doesn't account for the drawback at all. Most cards with a drawback get slightly stronger upgrades (wild strike, masterful stab, auto-shields) to go with their already high base numbers. Bronze idol and gelatinous cube both make it much better.
<cleanse> aswell
